greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lucky factor of n.
comment: This sequence is analogous to the smallest prime factor of n (A020639). If n is lucky, a(n)=0; if n is unlucky, a(n) is the number that rejects n from the lucky number sieve. This is 2 for even numbers, and a lucky number >= 3 for odd unlucky numbers.
link: Max Barrentine, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: If A145649(n) = 1 [when n is lucky], a(n) = 0, else if n is even, a(n) = 2, otherwise a(n) = A000959(A265859(n)) = A000959(A260438(n)).
program: (Scheme) (define (A264940 n) (if (= 1 (A145649 n)) 0 (if (even? n) 2 (A000959 (A260438 n))))) ;; _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 11 2016
results.author: _Max Barrentine_, Dec 09 2015
ext: Formula corrected and comment clarified by _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 11 2016
